reviews.review_msg: I have never written a review but I have decided to write one for Professor Meyer today. She is perhaps the finest professor SFU has to offer, she is extremely friendly and knowledgeable. If you have the chance to take a class with her, don't think twice, just take it!

Horrible class structure! She is clearly very educated on the topic but does not teach instead wants students to regurgitate articles the whole class. Do not know what we pay tuition for when the professor does not teach, if we wanted to listen to fellow students for three hours we would not need professors!

Does not tech! Her teaching stye is not very organized she lectures for a short time maybe an hour then its up to students to ramble on about articles for two hours everyclass!The class is not difficult but its more like you are teaching yourself the material because she does not so she forces students to summarize articles every class. Painful!

Peggy is a professor with high intellectual integrity and open-mindedness. I understand some remarked her class is dry. I think her teaching style is more appropriate for graduate classes. I took her class when I was a four year student and had some basic knowledge in the area. I learned alot form her class. Her selection of readings are grt

I took a class with Professor Meyer and for someone who seems very seasoned as a professor, her organization of this class is very poor. Her 1 hr lecture is so dry, and it is extremely difficult to filter and decide what is actually important. The remaining 2 hours is listening to your peers discuss the readings. She doesn't do a very good job of d

A nice lady but her "lectures"(1 hr) are so dry and uninformative.  The rest of the 2.5 hours involve you listening to your peers regurgitate the articles they may or may not have understood.  She is a bit tough on the mid-term and especially the papers.  Overall the course could have been a lot better.

Lectures are very dry. She could use powerpoints or ask the students questions to keep people from falling asleep.  discussions are lively. fair marker.  I am sad that she is retiring soon. tends to choose one or two students in each class and play favourites.  She does accept everyones point of view.  be careful of falling asleep in class.

Professor Meyer is awesome! Took 2 courses w/her. It is usually 40% paper, 40% final, 20% part. You make your paper topic, she gives you previous exams to study from for final, plus a presentation. She looks for a lot of analysis & critical thinking. Extremely fair marker. Really kind, funny, interesting woman!

Professor Meyer is an informed professor.  She comes to class prepared and expects the same.  Extremely fair marker and extremely helpful.  Exams are tough, get ready to do a lot of readings.  Otherwise she is laid back.
She was pretty chill. Marking scheme was fair, easy going. Easily recommended.
One of the most interesting, helpful, and kindest professors in the poli-sci dept. Her marking is fair and her style is impeccable. I hope she teaches for years to come....
She is a nice prof but the class is extremely dry.  She is not as easy as everyone says, she expects alot of analysis.

shes very experienced and gives you every angle of the story... relaxed teaching style and very approachable! very fair marker and great class structure (mt,essay and participation, no final) highly recommended! wait lists for her class are loonnnggg!!

shes traveled everywhere she teaches about! Yes, the course is a little dry but shes an easy marker compared to some of the other **** profs. And shes friendly and easy to talk to, definitely will take her again!!
Great prof. Can't complain. She's 64 and has tons of experience. Highly recommended.

A high quality prof who really knows her stuff. Being travelled to China and knew a lot about it. Though she does criticize, but always in an neutral perspective. I found this prof very interesting and engaging. Looking forward to take more of her classes in the future :)
Good Prof! Take her class, she knows her stuff and communicates it well.
No Comments

knows her stuff and she's not only speaks about theory... but about things that happened, are in the news, tangible. She's travelled the world as a researcher, interviewed incredible people, etc, etc... completely worth it. If you like discussion and generous marking... she's the one!
Friendly and makes you feel comfortable about speaking your opinions in class. Reasonable expectations and a very reasonable marker. Glad to have taken her class.
Peggy seems like a nice person but can be pretty flakey at times. Her class was very, very boring. Don't take this class if you want to be engaged.
Excellent class, excellent attitude from the professor.  A pleasure to have taken her course.
Hallelujah my saviour!!! brought my GPA up and was such a kind and caring person compared to the other garbage profs I've had. I highly recommend her :)

Suppose to be a four hour class, only gives a one hour lecture which is useless, then you proceed to a seminar for two hours!!!! Boaring, zzzzz-hey she usually uses the mock midterm she'll handout as the real midterm.....
Excellent professor..excellent attitude and certainlly knows a lot!
easy exams.  informative and she'll make u interested in what u r studying.
Lecture informative. Exam schedule was easy on students.
enthusiastic and knowledgable. easy marker
Dr. Meyer is an excellent lecturer using both enthusiasm and relevant materials
